Ingredients.3: 12 ounces tomatillo verde Mexican cooking sauce (such as Herdez®)

Ingredients.7: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste (Optional)

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Directions.2: Place corn tortilla pieces on the prepared baking sheet and spray with cooking spray.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, 5 to 10 minutes.

Directions.4: Combine tortillas and tomatillo sauce in a skillet over medium heat and simmer until tortillas have softened, about 5 minutes. Spoon mixture into individual ramekins. Top with queso fresco, crema, and sliced onions. Garnish with cilantro.
